SEARCH
Package sh.brane.core.tx

Class BlobDecoder

java.lang.Object
sh.brane.core.tx.BlobDecoder
public final class BlobDecoder extends Object
Decoder for extracting original data from EIP-4844 blobs.

This class provides the inverse operation of SidecarBuilder.from(byte[]), decoding blobs back to the original data that was encoded.

Decoding Process

The decoding process:

  1. Extracts 31 usable bytes from each 32-byte field element (skipping the 0x00 high byte)
  2. Reads the 8-byte big-endian length prefix from the first bytes
  3. Returns the original data bytes based on the length prefix
Since:
0.2.0
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • decode

      public static byte[] decode(List<Blob> blobs)
      Decodes the original data from a list of blobs.

      This method reverses the encoding performed by SidecarBuilder.from(byte[]).

      Decoding Scheme

      Each blob consists of 4096 field elements (32 bytes each). Due to the BLS modulus constraint, the first byte of each field element is a 0x00 prefix byte, leaving only 31 usable bytes per field element. The decoding process:

      1. Extracts 31 bytes from each 32-byte field element (skipping the 0x00 prefix byte)
      2. Reads the 8-byte big-endian length prefix from the first bytes of the extracted data
      3. Returns exactly that many bytes of original data following the length prefix
      Parameters:
      blobs - the list of blobs to decode, must not be null or empty
      Returns:
      the original data bytes that were encoded into the blobs
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if blobs is null or contains null elements
      IllegalArgumentException - if blobs is empty or if the encoded length is invalid
      See Also:
      • for the encoding scheme
